intro: Psephellus brevifimbriatus, commonly known as the narrow-fringed sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a distinctive fringed appearance at the edges. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments.
